parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: For paged requests, specifies the offset from the first row in the collection to the first row returned, default 0.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: For paged requests, specifies the max number of rows to return, default is 20.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: For paged requests, specifies whether to reverse the sort order, default is 'asc'.

parameters.description: Some browsers do not support certain HTTP methods (e.g. PUT, PATCH and DELETE), this optional parameter enables you to use a POST request but ask the server to treat the request as a PUT, PATCH or DELETE.

apis.description: Interact with the list of resources.

name.name: name
name.description: A short name for the error message

message.name: message
message.description: A human readable and client friendly error message
message.example: The API method does not exist

transfer.name: transfer

user.name: user
user.description: The user who initiated the transfer.

sendingAccount.name: sendingAccount
sendingAccount.description: The account which is sending the funds and into which any refunds should be paid.

rate.name: rate
rate.description: The rate at which the transfer occured.

transfer.notes:
Transfers are the key resource when working with TransferWise, they describe the end-to-end process of registering the intent to transfer funds, performing payments into the TransferWise platform, the exchange of funds, and the pay out to the receiving account.  

A transfer is initiated by a user, that user may be both the sender and receiver, or they may be sending or receiving money funds from an account owned by another user.  However, the user must own at least one of the accounts involved (sending or receiving). 

If the other account is new and is not owned by the current user it needs to be linked to an unregistered user.

user.name: user

pref.name: pref
pref.description: The personal reference for the user.

user.notes: The user account resource can be the owner of several profiles, the user contains information on how a user logs into TransferWise.

company.name: company
company.notes: Profiles are specific representations of users, a single user may have multiple profiles, for example a business and a personal profile.

role.name: role
role.description: Role assigned to user in a company

account.name: account

profile.name: profile
profile.description: The profile who owns this account.

currency.name: currency
currency.description: The currency used by the account

iban.name: iban
iban.description: Information for iban accounts, only present if type = iban.

swift.name: swift
swift.description: Information for iban accounts, only present if type = swift.

account.notes: Accounts are holders of value, they can pay out or receive funds.  There may be a number of different types of accounts depending on country, or other factors.  Depending on the type of account extra information will be included/required specific to that account type.

payment.name: payment
payment.notes:
Payments resources represent the specific movements of funds between accounts.  A single transfer may involve several payments, for example the payment of funds from the sender to TransferWise, and the payment from TransferWise to the recipient account.

Occasionally a sender may pay in the incorrect amount and may have to make a second payment between the same two accounts, this would become a second payment resource rather than an amendment to the first payment.

verification.name: verification

profileId.name: profileId
profileId.description: The profile asscoiated with this document

key.name: key
key.description: The key for this data, this key is used to update the associated profile.

verification.notes:
A verification is a document required to verify information about the user.  We will often need additional data about a user to be able to create or complete transfers.  Documents may require manual checking, the status property will indicate where we are in this process.

REQUIRES FURTHER CONSIDERATION.

key.name: key
key.description: The key for this data, this key is used to update the associated profile.

name.name: name
name.description: A localised name for the required document.

description.name: description
description.description: A localised description of this verification.

reason.name: reason
reason.description: A localised reason for why we need the user to upload this information.

user-required.name: user-required

key.name: key
key.description: The key for this data, this key is used to update the associated profile.

name.name: name
name.description: A localise name for this property

description.name: description
description.description: A localised description of the property

regex.name: regex
regex.description: A regular expression that the value must satisfy.  Only for text and number types.

user-required.notes:
Required verifications are pieces of information that we need added to the users profile to be able to create a transfer using their chosen quote (route, amount, payment method).  This may be additional information like a users address, or it may be a document that we need to prove the users identity.

REQUIRES FURTHER CONSIDERATION.

currency.name: currency

prefix.name: prefix
prefix.description: The prefix used when displaying the currency

postfix.name: postfix
postfix.description: The postfix used when displaying the currency

delimeter.name: delimeter
delimeter.description: The delimeter used when displaying the currency

currency.notes: A currency resource contains meta data about currencies.

rate.name: rate

generated.name: generated
generated.description: The time at which this rate was generated

rate.notes:
Rate is a simple resource that gives the exchange rate between a source currency and a target currency.  Rates are not a commitment of any kind, the are simply information that can be shared with the end user and give no guarantee that a transfer will occur using this exact value.  

If a user is authenticated they may receive real-time market data, otherwise the data will tend to be delayed by 15 minutes, this allows us to meet our agreements with rate suppliers.

quote.name: quote

payOut.name: payOut
payOut.description: The amount that will be recieved.

expires.name: expires
expires.description: The date and time that the quote expires.

profileId.name: profileId
profileId.description: Optionally supply a profile id and the quote will pass back any missing verification details necessary for this transfer..

verificationRequired.name: verificationRequired
verificationRequired.description: The list of missing verifications required for this transfer.  Only returned if a profileId is supplied.

payInMethod.name: payInMethod
payInMethod.description: The method that will be used to pay in the money.

profileRequired.name: profileRequired
profileRequired.description: Any additional profile information we will require to complete a transfer.  Only returned if a profileId is returned.

quote.notes:
Quotes contain the rates and fees that we are our offering to the customer for a specific transfer, depending on route, amount or other factors we may be to offer a fixed rate or a variable rate with limits that will cause the transfer to be cancelled and money returned.  

A quote is required to create a transfer.  Quotes will also contain an expiry time after which it will no longer be possible to use that quote when creating a transfer.  Depending on situation the API client may elect to handle quote expiry transparently, generating a new quote if required without user input.

country.name: country

canSend.name: canSend
canSend.description: Can we send from this country?

canReceive.name: canReceive
canReceive.description: Can we receiv in this country?

country.notes: A country resource contains meta data about countries.  The country object also describes if we are able to send and/or receive transfers originating in that country.

iban.name: iban
iban.notes: Specific information relating to IBAN base accounts.

swift.name: swift
swift.notes: Specific information relating to SWIFT based accounts.

quoteId.name: quoteId
quoteId.description: The quotefor which we need to check verification.

profileId.name: profileId
profileId.description: The profile that will be used for the transfer.

payInMethod.name: payInMethod
payInMethod.description: How will the user be paying in

payInMethod.name: payInMethod

accountNumber.name: accountNumber
accountNumber.description: The account number to pay into

sortCode.name: sortCode
sortCode.description: The sort code to pay into

max.name: max
max.description: The max amount transferable using this method.

min.name: min
min.description: The min amount transferable using this method.

payInMethod.notes: The method of payment being used to transfer funds.

responseHeaders.name: Content-Type
responseHeaders.description: The media type of the body

responseHeaders.name: Content-Length
responseHeaders.description: How many bytes the content body contains

responseHeaders.name: Content-Encoding
responseHeaders.description: What, if any, compression is being used.

responseHeaders.name: ETag
responseHeaders.description: A short string representation of the resource, useful for seeing if it has changed.

responseHeaders.name: Last-Modified
responseHeaders.description: When was the resource last modified

responseHeaders.name: Link
responseHeaders.description: Links to other pages of data in the collection, valid values are: first, prev, next, last

responseHeaders.name: X-Total-Count
responseHeaders.description: The number of items in the collection
